voicesplitting.gui

Class VoiceSplittingGUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • voicesplitting.gui.VoiceSplittingGUI
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class VoiceSplittingGUI
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    The VoiceSplittingGUI is the main controller for the GUI, and contains the main(String[]) method which should be run to load the GUI.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Andrew McLeod - 17 June, 2015
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • serialVersionUID

        private static final long serialVersionUID
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • usingGui

        public static boolean usingGui
        Field to tell whether we are using a gui or not.

        This will be used in the model's intensive loops to decide whether to call Thread.sleep(1) to check if a Worker has been cancelled, as this check is only needed if we are running from a GUI.

        By default this value is false, but the main(String[]) method sets it to true before loading the GUI.

      • fileNameLabel

        private javax.swing.JLabel fileNameLabel
        The label showing the currently loaded MIDI file's name.

        private javax.swing.SwingWorker currentWorker
        The currently running SwingWorker. This is saved to know whether to cancel an existing action when a new one is executed through the executeSwingWorker(SwingWorker) method.

        public void loadNewFile()
        Choose and load a new MIDI File.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If some I/O error occurred when reading the file.
        javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException - If the file contained some invlaid MIDI data.

      • shouldUseChannel

        protected boolean shouldUseChannel()
        Get whether we are supposed to be reading in data with the correct voice as channels or tracks. This value is read in from the useChannelCheckBox.
        Returns:
        True if we should use channels. False to use tracks.

      • executeSwingWorker

        public void executeSwingWorker(javax.swing.SwingWorker swingWorker)
        Execute the given SwingWorker. This includes cancelling the currentWorker, if it is still running.
        Parameters:
        swingWorker - The SwingWorker we want to execute.
